body.name: The Bookshop and the Barbarian: A Cozy Fantasy Novel
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 23 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 14 hrs 56 mins
body.description: Explore its many rooms, pick something nice off the shelf, and have a little read by the fire at the Cozy Quill Bookshop.Running from strife in her homeland, Maribella Waters becomes the new owner of the fabled Cozy Quill. After finding squatters on her property, she employs Asteria Helsdottir, a giant, barbarian warrior woman more accustomed to swinging an axe than opening a book. Together, the odd couple must make a success out of the bookshop—and survive a dizzying procession of seasonal festivals.But the local evil noblewoman has other plans in mind. Threatened with being run off the land, Maribella and Asteria must use their wits to outsmart Lady Malicent and keep their business open. Along the way, the whole town lends a hand, and friendships are forged . . . along with a few secrets revealed.The Bookshop and the Barbarian is a low stakes, comedic and cozy fantasy with a slice-of-life, sapphic romance. It is about the celebration of books, autumn and winter, community, friendship, and unexpected romance. And it is also very patiently waiting for you to pick it up and read it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A romp of high fantasy hijinks and self aware surprizes!
reviews.reviewText: Don't think I didn't catch that reference to Legends and Lattes on page 88! An astounding read that had me laughing out loud or at least giggling in less safe conditions. This story is well written, its length is digestible and its full of a quirk that fans of the Fable video game series would come to appreciate. References abound in this lovely Sapphic jaunt and my heart is made better by having read it. Thank you gloriously Morgan Stang! I LOVE "THE BOOKSHOP AND THE BARBARIAN".

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It is a tad silly....
reviews.reviewText: The Bookshop And The Barbarian is advertised as a cozy fantasy. I would say less cozy and more silly. Not a bad thing if you like humor. Let’s explain the plot. Or as much as I can without spoiling it.Maribella Waters buys a bookshop in the middle of a small town called the Cozy Quill. The building is full of books, a maze of rooms, boarded up doors, and so forth. How could she pay for such a wonderful bookshop? She got lucky.Then there is the barbarian Asteria Helsdottir who she needs to hire for reasons. Why is the barbarian in the town? Reasons.Both have backgrounds they don’t seem to wish to talk about. And there are some issues they have to overcome. But I’ll leave that for you to discover. There IS a lot of fourth wall breaking. And any threat is quickly overcome.There are a few cultural references. The author hints at Minecraft. And there is a even reference to Legends & Lattes.But this story isn’t anywhere as involved as other fantasy novels. It is 187 pages yet I could of finished it in a day.Anything in the book was put there to help solve the problems. Or not. There is a few scenes which went in a totally different way than I thought they would. But there are a few scenes which you could have seen from the start. Four out of five. I enjoyed but never really found it that funny. It felt forced.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Fun and Iight-hearted
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book. The parts when the author talks to the reader are fun and make the book stand out. The rest is fun and humorous. A bit goofy with very likable characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book more than I thought I would when I started the first chapter. The farther I read the more enamored by the characters I became. It is quirky and reminds me of a hidden away English town where each community member add another quirky quality to the tale. Give it a go and keep reading!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ridiculous but I had to Finished it
reviews.reviewText: If you enjoy books that can't be bothered to take themselves seriously with obnoxious narrators that randomly butt in, this is the book for you. (And I should add it's also interactive). I haven't been so mad about a book in ages. If it wasn't on my phone I would have probably thrown it at a few walls. Before proceeding to go and pick it up and continue reading. This book was, in a word -for me- infuriating. I haven't vented, complained, and whined about a book so much in my life. Freakin narrators that can't read minds, have too many bosom metaphors (even with the limit), and dare to suggest they exist in the same world that one of my favorite books exist. The Audacity! I mean truly. How dare it!That all being said it was entertaining. It held my attention. Despite the nonsensical narrator it was interesting and well written. It had references I caught (hate the hills short story as a side) and more I probably didn't. I respect the author for having the courage to write this book and share it with the public. Honestly this probably deserves 5 stars but I'm giving it 4 because I'm a spiteful little monster. Right now is my 6 months to rage!Who knows, maybe I'll torture myself and read it again someday...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: If you're in a bit of reading slump or need a refresher in between books, this is a great story. I found it to be a read best curled up in your favourite spot with a blanket and your beverage of choice ☺️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars sapphic cozy fantasy written specifically for me
reviews.reviewText: This book is very polarizing in reviews, because it has a lot of parts, esp the humor, that you either dig or you don’t. Well, I dug. It has a sort of “written to market” feel, but it’s like that market is specifically me. The comparison to Legends and Lattes is very obvious and there’s a lot of nudge-nudge wink-wink about d’n’d type tropes, references, and memes. Also one reference that feels like it was plucked right out of this sub. The fourth wall is practically non-existent and the narrator often talks to the reader. That’s all stuff that I’m sure can fall flat for a lot of people but I found it hilarious and had to send screenshots to all my friends.It’s a short book, I read in almost half of it in one go, and it was funny and light, great for taking my mind off my regularly scheduled evening anxiety. I haven’t even played that much d’n’d but I am a sucker for tabletop rpg parody bits and found them super fun.The main character felt very much like a reader insert. Yes, I would love a huge bookshop fully stacked and reading by the fire to my tall muscular barbarian-hired muscle (in this situation repeating muscle a few times in a single sentence is warranted, trust me). She’s alright as a character, very sensible at times, and has a mysterious past she’s hiding.The barbarian is lots of fun. She’s got that super direct “you people are weird let’s just fight it out” vibe and always considers violence the best option.The plot was nice and low stakes, lots of book reading, being cozy, a sprinkle of arch-nemesis and getting to know the townfolks, which were alll pretty fun characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It's very cozy and cute, but the writing style is not what I usually enjoy.But, if you enjoy goofy, cozy, low stakes stories, this is for you!
Such an entertaining book! I have just found this genre and adore it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A cup of hot cocoa for the soul. A never ending series of twists and spins to keep u guessing. A lovely book from start to finish.

Why isn't this book more talked about?It gives us that warm, cozy feeling, while also making us laughing at the incredible situations the characters get into!Super easy and fast to read, a palate cleaner between more heavy reads! Really recommend!❤️

I don’t think I can explain how much I liked this book with english being my second language, but so you know, I gave it 5 stars, and I’m not THAT generous with stars.This is one of the most delightful books I’ve ever read, it got me laughing out loud. Never in my life a book made me laugh like this one. I enjoyed every second of it, mainly because of the way you’re able to fall in love with the little village, the bookshop and ALL of the characters, and also because of the way the author gets in between the story and their sense of humour which gives the book a silly (but cozy) atmosphere
The novel is narrated with a ‘dear reader’ Winnie the Pooh style. It is mildly amusing but the narrative style just sets my teeth on edge.
